user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of ahc_echo:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
ahc_echo (void *cls,
          struct MHD_Connection *connection,
          const char *url,
          const char *method,
          const char *version,
          const char *upload_data,
          size_t *upload_data_size,
          void **req_cls)
{
  static int aptr;
  struct MHD_Response *response;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  (void) cls;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) url;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) version;           /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data;       /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data_size;  /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  if (0 != strcmp (method, "GET"))
    return MHD_NO;              /* unexpected method */
  if (&aptr != *req_cls)
  {
    /* do never respond on first call */
    *req_cls = &aptr;
    return MHD_YES;
  }
  *req_cls = NULL;                  /* reset when done */
  response = MHD_create_response_empty (MHD_RF_NONE);
  ret = MHD_queue_response (connection,
                            MHD_HTTP_NO_CONTENT,
                            response);
  MHD_destroy_response (response);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
*req_cls = NULL;                  /* reset when done */
response = MHD_create_response_empty (MHD_RF_NONE);
ret = MHD_queue_response (connection,
                          MHD_HTTP_NO_CONTENT,
                          response);
MHD_destroy_response (response);
return ret;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: ahc_echo does not call itself directly. A violation would occur only if one of the called library functions (e.g. MHD_queue_response or MHD_destroy_response) re-entered the request handler and invoked ahc_echo (ahc_echo -> MHD_queue_response -> ahc_echo), which would be an indirect recursive call and thus violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2.
